required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The researchers would like to know how long pregnant women spend in different positions during the night - and how often women change positions - across pregnancy. The researchers also want to see if the sleep monitor is able to improve sleep behaviors

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of sleep time spent in the supine position as measured by the Pregnancy Coach
primary_outcome.description: Will be conducted using the naturalistic arm (deactivated device). Simple descriptive statistics to report the average number of minutes and the average proportion of supine sleep per week.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of sleep time spent with objective snoring as indicated by the Pregnancy Coach
secondary_outcome.description: Will be conducted using the naturalistic arm (deactivated device). Proportion of time will be determined during each gestational week.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants where their 'going to sleep' position was the same as their dominant sleep position
secondary_outcome.description: Will be conducted using the naturalistic arm (deactivated device). We will determine whether the "going to sleep" position during each gestational week is predictive of the most dominant sleep position.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of sleep position changes following alert from Pregnancy Coach
secondary_outcome.description: Will be conducted using the intervention arm (active device). Percentage of sleep position changes in response to an alert from the Pregnancy Coach will be reported for each gestational week.

arm_group.description: Wear deactivated pregnancy coach device for the remainder of pregnancy.
Wear active device for remainder of pregnancy (including 3 day run-in period)

intervention.description: Naturalistic monitoring of their typical sleep patterns and behaviors
The Pregnancy Coach will begin to deliver alerts when supine sleep is detected. Sleep metrics will be visible on the smartphone app.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least 28 weeks pregnant
- Receiving pre-natal care at Michigan Medicine
- Have either and Android or iPhone smartphone
Exclusion Criteria:
- Less then 28 weeks pregnant
- Receiving pre-natal care external to Michigan Medicine
- Does not poses a smartphone

responsible_party.investigator_title: Research Associate Professor, Neurology, Research Associate Professor, Obstetrics and Gynecology, Medical School and Associate Research Scientist, Dentistry, Department of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, School of Dentistry

patient_data.ipd_description: The study team does not have plans to actively share data, however, they are open to collaboration following contact with the investigator.
